name: 余盛延
objective:
本課程旨在發展學生獨立規劃及從事研究的能力，學生可在指導老師的指導下，依個別的需求選擇研究的方向，訂定題目，並獨立完成研究計畫，撰寫報告。
專題研究範圍含：
實驗研究
量調查研究或質調查研究
個案研究
回溯研究
文化比較研究
理論闡述研究
schedule:
02/20  Research Project: General Discussion

02/27  Research Project: Exploration of an Appropriate Text

03/05  Research Project: Decision on a Suitable Text

03/12  Research Project: Preliminary Reading: Get some information  
       about the text you choose from the Internet, reference books.
       or any other reliable sources. 

03/19  Research Project: Discuss what you learn with your advisor

03/26  Research Project: Consult at least 2 scholarly journal 
       articles for criticisms on the text

04/02  Research Project: Inform your advisor whether you might be 
       interested in the text

04/09  Research Project: Purchase the text you need. Read the text.

04/16  Research Project: Continue to read the text. Discuss questions 
       you might have with your advisor.

04/23  Research Project: Continue to read the text. Discuss questions 
       you might have with your advisor.

04/30  Research Project: Continue to read the text. Discuss questions 
       you might have with your advisor.

05/07  Research Project: Try to come up with a topic and write a 
       thesis statement about your topic.

05/14  Research Project: Compile a working bibliography for the 
       project and discuss it with your advisor.

05/21  Research Project: Collect journal articles that are relevant 
       to your project.

05/28  Research Project: Analyze the articles your read and identify 
       the major issues addressed in them.

06/04  Research Project: Discuss with your advisor about the major 
       issues you might want to address and explain to your advisor 
       why you are interested in those issues.

06/11  Research Project: Make a final decision on your topic for the 
       project.

06/18  Research Project: Prepare a formal written statement of 
       purpose for your research project, including a topic, a thesis 
       statement, an annotated working bibliography. Prepare an 
       outline for your project during the summer vacation.
scorePolicy:
Grading Policy: Evaluation of your progress in the research project will be based on your performance under the guidance of your advisor. To demonstrate that you successfully complete the first semester of this project, you are required to follow the step-by-step guidance of your advisor, select a text you will discuss in time, consult secondary sources and discuss the issues with your advisor, compile an annotated working bibliography, decide on a topic, write a thesis statement, and most importantly keep your advisor informed of the status of your project throughout the semester. Please remember it is your responsibility to contact your advisor. Generally

successful choice of a text: 30%

dutiful discussion with your advisor about your project: 30%

topic, bibliogrphy, thesis statement: 40%

schedule:
First one-fourth:  Articulate the intent, scope and methodology of your project.  What are you trying to find out?  Why?  Establish a regular working schedule.  Read primary source materials, keeping a journal of your insights.

Second one-fourth:  Continue reading and writing about your primary source or sources, trying to establish a theme or motif that you see as informing the entire work.  At this point it is also allowable to follow any clues with which your primary texts may be presenting you.  Are particular authors mentioned?  Does the author spend a lot of time describing the land or the sea or furniture or architecture or a painting or a film or a cultural leitmotif?  Try to discover why by doing additional related research.

Third one-fourth:  Review critical sources and write responses to these critical ideas insofar as they are helpful (or not) in understanding your primary source.  DUE:  BIBLIOGRAPHY IN MLA FORMAT OF ALL SOURCES EMPLOYED SO FAR IN YOUR STUDY.

Final one-fourth:  Prepare a four-five page draft articulating your progress in your project thus far.  FIRST SEMESTER DRAFT DUE THE DAY BEFORE FINALS WEEK.
scorePolicy:
¼	Timeliness in meeting benchmarks (see Course Schedule below); journal writing
¼	Collaborating with senior project adviser to devise efficacious research and writing strategies
¼	Originality
¼	Care in choosing and utilizing sources
